content:
Diagnosis
	1. Small cell carcinoma of prostate with widespread metastases

	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	None indicated

	Chemotherapy
	15 Jan 2024 - 20 Mar 2024: Carboplatin/Etoposide - 4 cycles completed

	Clinical studies
	Phase II PROPEL study - randomised to Arm B (Lurbinectedin)

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease in liver and bone metastases

	Current issues
	Fatigue, bone pain, reduced mobility

	Summary of consultation
	Reviewed today on cycle 2 of trial medication. Unfortunately experiencing significant clinical deterioration with worsening bone pain requiring increased opiate analgesia. Latest CT shows 30% increase in liver metastases and new bone lesions in thoracic spine. Performance status now ECOG 2-3. Trial blood samples collected as per protocol. Chromogranin A increased from 125 to 280. PSA stable at 2.1.

	Further investigations
	MRI spine booked for 25/4/24 due to new thoracic pain

	Medication prescribed
	Oxycodone MR increased to 40mg BD
Pregabalin started 75mg BD

	Follow up
	Next trial visit in 2 weeks with CT assessment
Urgent palliative care review arranged

	Required actions
	Trial discontinuation to be discussed at next visit if further clinical deterioration
Palliative radiotherapy to be considered pending MRI findings

primary_cancer.metastases: liver metastases, lung metastases, bone metastases

cancer_timeline.value: Enrolled in Phase II PROPEL study - randomised to Arm B (Lurbinectedin)
Chromogranin A increased from 125 to 280, PSA stable at 2.1
CT shows 30% increase in liver metastases and new bone lesions in thoracic spine

patient_facts.value: Worsening bone pain requiring increased opiate analgesia

status_updates.value: Metastatic small cell prostate cancer with progressive disease on trial medication. Significant clinical deterioration with worsening symptoms.
Progressive disease with 30% increase in liver metastases and new bone lesions
Currently on cycle 2 of trial medication (Lurbinectedin)
MRI spine booked for 25/4/24 due to new thoracic pain
Next trial visit in 2 weeks with CT assessment, urgent palliative care review arranged
